title: Navy Surface Force in Deep Trouble

content: No, the Naval Surface Force is NOT in trouble. It is still the best, the finest, and the most powerful and respected Naval Surface Force in the world. Regardless of who is president, our US Navy will NEVER take a back seat to any other. The LCS program has gone WAY over budget. These issues are well-documented; no need to repeat them here. And the contracts were suspended by the Navy under the Bush Administration, which -- IMO -- was a wise move. Anybody want to do their own research on what has plagued the USS SAN ANTONIO? Their issues are legion, and began -- again! -- during the Bush Adminsitration, though I can assure you GWB was in no way responsible. But is just one ship! Only ONE in the world's best Navy. And yet you all spool up over it... It chaps my hide to read crap like, "U.S. sea power today is "on a bad glide slope." And nothing burns me up more than people who believe it!

content: quote: Originally posted by 6486143: quote: Originally posted by SpaceHauk: RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,187044,00.html Obama thinks he can "persuade" our enemies to lay down their arms and nefarious plans that they hold against us by being a "kinder, gentler, nation"..... International diplomacy is moot if you don't have the strength to back up your talk. How on earth did this guy ever get elected???? ......The Navy always has problems with leftist control of the budget..... What's any of your anti-Obama rant got to do with the point of the article??? "As well documented, the San Antonio (LPD 17) amphibious ships and littoral combat ships (LCS) are far behind schedule and over cost. Indeed, the San Antonio herself took almost three years from when the Navy placed her in commission until she was ready to undertake her first overseas deployment -- probably a record for Navy surface ships. Meanwhile, after some ten years and many millions of dollars in development, the Chief of Naval Operations, Admiral Gary Roughead has truncated the Zumwalt (DDG 1000) advanced destroyer program -- and undoubtedly wishes to cancel even the three ships already funded by Congress." (Note: several studies have sown that DDG 1000 is vulnerable to a variety of anti-ship missiles. That is why the Navy wants to build more Arleigh Burkes.) And you so-called conservatives say you're in favor of cutting wasteful spending and programs that don't work. I guess none of that matters when you have ODS. You'd rather let them

International diplomacy is moot if you don't have the strength to back up your talk. How on earth did this guy ever get elected???? ......The Navy always has problems with leftist control of the budget.....

reply: What's any of your anti-Obama rant got to do with the point of the article??? "As well documented, the San Antonio (LPD 17) amphibious ships and littoral combat ships (LCS) are far behind schedule and over cost. Indeed, the San Antonio herself took almost three years from when the Navy placed her in commission until she was ready to undertake her first overseas deployment -- probably a record for Navy surface ships. Meanwhile, after some ten years and many millions of dollars in development, the Chief of Naval Operations, Admiral Gary Roughead has truncated the Zumwalt (DDG 1000) advanced destroyer program -- and undoubtedly wishes to cancel even the three ships already funded by Congress." (Note: several studies have sown that DDG 1000 is vulnerable to a variety of anti-ship missiles. That is why the Navy wants to build more Arleigh Burkes.) And you so-called conservatives say you're in favor of cutting wasteful spending and programs that don't work. I guess none of that matters when you have ODS. You'd rather let them
title: Navy Surface Force in Deep Trouble

content: quote: Originally posted by 1WW: No, the Naval Surface Force is NOT in trouble. It is still the best, the finest, and the most powerful and respected Naval Surface Force in the world. Regardless of who is president, our US Navy will NEVER take a back seat to any other. The LCS program has gone WAY over budget. These issues are well-documented; no need to repeat them here. And the contracts were suspended by the Navy under the Bush Administration, which -- IMO -- was a wise move. Anybody want to do their own research on what has plagued the USS SAN ANTONIO? Their issues are legion, and began -- again! -- during the Bush Adminsitration, though I can assure you GWB was in no way responsible. But is just one ship! Only ONE in the world's best Navy. And yet you all spool up over it... It chaps my hide to read crap like, "U.S. sea power today is "on a bad glide slope." And nothing burns me up more than people who believe it! Couldn't agree more. I find it funny that people want to talk about LPD-17 or the LCS, but do not even consider the success of the DDG-51, new SSN (USS Virginia)class, or any other program that is going well. Scrap LCS and go with a new multi-purpose frigate for the mission.

content: No, the Naval Surface Force is NOT in trouble. It is still the best, the finest, and the most powerful and respected Naval Surface Force in the world. Regardless of who is president, our US Navy will NEVER take a back seat to any other. The LCS program has gone WAY over budget. These issues are well-documented; no need to repeat them here. And the contracts were suspended by the Navy under the Bush Administration, which -- IMO -- was a wise move. Anybody want to do their own research on what has plagued the USS SAN ANTONIO? Their issues are legion, and began -- again! -- during the Bush Adminsitration, though I can assure you GWB was in no way responsible. But is just one ship! Only ONE in the world's best Navy. And yet you all spool up over it... It chaps my hide to read crap like, "U.S. sea power today is "on a bad glide slope." And nothing burns me up more than people who believe it!
reply: No, the Naval Surface Force is NOT in trouble. It is still the best, the finest, and the most powerful and respected Naval Surface Force in the world. We will be in a world of s h i t if they have their way and you know it. "Thank you, for your support." - Bartles & Jaymes
